intro: Scyphostelma brachyphyllum, commonly known as the short-stemmed star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a dense rosette at the base. Scyphostelma brachyphyllum is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil to thrive.
